cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with a task assignment problem in crowdsourcing, which involves worker selection and reliability estimation. This problem is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including artificial intelligence (cs.AI), human-computer interaction (cs.HC), machine learning (cs.LG), social and information networks (cs.SI), and information retrieval (cs.IR). The proposed method uses a contextual bandit formulation to balance exploration and exploitation in worker selection, which is a common technique in machine learning and reinforcement learning. Therefore, cs.AI and cs.LG are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the practical implications of the proposed method, which is relevant to cs.HC and cs.SI. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method using real-world data, which is relevant to cs.IR.
